sentences.english: The South Korean puppet regime must return my daughter to her mother's arms right away.
sentences.chinese: 韩国傀儡政权必须马上送还我的女儿到母亲的怀抱。

sentences.english: The "Manchukuo" Puppet Regime was a figurehead set up by the Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 伪满政府是由日本扶持建立的傀儡政权。

sentences.english: They were determined to liberate the people from the puppet regime's dark rule.
sentences.chinese: 他们决心把人民从傀儡政权的黑暗统治下解放出来。

sentences.english: The Education Contacts Between China and Japan Ruled by Mongjiang Puppet Government;
sentences.chinese: 伪满政府是由日本扶持建立的傀儡政权。

sentences.english: Americans have been exporting puppet government around the world for many decades.
sentences.chinese: 美国人在数十年里向全世界输出了傀儡政权。

sentences.english: The Manchukuo Puppet Regime was a figurehead set up by the Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 伪满政府是由日本扶持建立的傀儡政权。

sentences.english: He followed him north and then the puppet regime collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 他跟溥仪一起到了东北，可是傀儡政权却又崩溃了。

definition: Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII
Korean Empire, from fall of Joseon dynasty in 1897 to annexation by Japan in 1910
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
Great East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere, Japanese wartime slogan for their short-lived Pacific Empire, first enunciated by Prime Minister Prince KONOE Fumimaro 近衛文麿|近卫文麿 in 1938
pinyin: Da4 Dong1 ya4 Gong4 rong2 quan1

definition: the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
Syngman Rhee (1875-1965), US trained Korean politician and dictator, president of Republic of Korea 1948-1960
use Chinese collaborators to subdue the Chinese (imperialist policy)
